Build Log

Honda CX500 Cafe Racer — 1981

Canarin Garage is transforming a high-mile (80,000 km) 1981 Honda CX500 into a bespoke cafe racer finished in matte black with gold and brushed aluminium accents. A hand-built subframe, Motogadget control suite, Rae-San programmable ignition, and a full monoshock conversion deliver modern reliability while keeping the V-twin character. Follow each phase—from strip-down to the first fire-up.

Custom Subframe YSS Monoshock Motogadget Suite GSXR Front End Brembo Rear Setup Seat TBD
Current Phase

Engine Reassembly & Install Prep

Engine stripped, bead-blasted, and ready for final assembly. OEM brown-code bearings are on the bench and reassembly of the bottom end is underway before the refreshed lump returns to the frame.

Focus

Buttoning up engine internals, sealing cases, final monoshock clearances

Next milestone

Drop engine back in, reconnect wiring, exhaust, and new coils/solenoid

Last updated: Nov 2025

Progress

Build Timeline

Each milestone tracks dates, goals, parts used, and notes. Replace placeholders with detailed logs and images.

  1. July 2025

    Acquisition & Baseline

    Bike sourced in original condition showing just over 80,000 km. Compression checked, fluids drained, initial ride recorded.

    Notes: catalog OEM parts worth saving; photograph factory wiring; weigh major components before teardown.

  2. August 2025

    Full Teardown

    Frame, engine, and drivetrain separated. Harness labeled, stock airbox and subframe removed for redesign.

    Notes: document bearing conditions; record clearances; prepare media library for upcoming photo set.

  3. September 2025

    Mock-up & Fabrication

    Custom rear loop welded, tank re-centered, battery tray relocated under seat hump, rearsets mocked in aluminum.

    Notes: finalize stance targets (ride height, rake); collect measurements for custom stainless exhaust routing.

  4. November 2025

    Engine Rebuild & Wiring Prep

    Engine cases stripped and coated; internals inspected and refurbished. Bottom end is being reassembled with brown-code bearings before the powerplant goes back into the frame.

    Notes: bench-test Rae-San ignition with Motogadget m-unit blue, pre-wire heat-shrink coded loom, confirm YSS monoshock clearances and ready the bike for engine reinstall.

Build Journal

Phase-by-phase deep dives

Longer-form notes for readers who want to follow every detail. Replace the prompts below with stories, torque values, parts lists, and lessons as each phase comes together.

Journal Entry

Baseline & First Impressions

July 2025

Capture the story of trailering home the 80,000 km CX500, running the first compression checks, and cataloging stock components. Explain why the factory carbs had to go, the switch to Murray's twin carb kit with K&N filters, and how the matte black + gold + brushed aluminium palette started to take shape while planning the rebuild.

80k km Murray's Carbs Paint Direction

Journal Entry

Mock-up Lessons

September 2025

Write about dialing in the GSXR front end, aligning the Cognito Moto triple tree, and setting preload on the custom YSS monoshock. Share how the Brembo rear setup mates with the custom rearsets and GSXR master, how the gold anodized spoke nipples tie into the shock and fork finishes, and walk through ideas for the seat while final upholstery decisions remain open.

GSXR Front YSS Mono Seat TBD

Journal Entry

Engine Strip & Refresh

November 2025

Log bearing clearances, torque specs, and assembly order as the refreshed engine comes together. Note the new coils, solenoid, and how the Rae-San ignition integrates with the Motogadget suite before the Murray's carbs and K&N setup go back on. Leave room for first-fire impressions once the lump is back in the frame.

Fabrication Log

Rear Loop Jig

Document the fixture setup for TIG welding the new rear loop. Capture tube bending angles, gusseting for the YSS monoshock mount, and Cognito Moto alignment points.

Tooling: JD2 Model 3 Estimated 4h
Electrical

Harness Mock-up

Lay out the new loom with color-coded heat-shrink. Integrate Motogadget m-unit blue, M-Lock keyless, Motoscope Pro, and Rae-San ignition triggers before final wrap.

Focus: Relay board ETA: 2 sessions
Finishing

Paint Study

Finalize the matte black + gold + brushed aluminium scheme—satin engine, gold suspension hardware, anodized spoke nipples, and brushed rearset plates. Track suppliers for ceramic coatings and anodised rearsets.

Palette v2 Review: Dec 02

Setup

Build Sheet

Update this checklist as parts arrive and systems get upgraded. Link to product pages or suppliers where possible.

Engine & Drivetrain

  • • CX500 497cc longitudinal V-twin — full rebuild in progress
  • • OEM brown-code connecting rod bearings on order
  • • Murray's twin carb kit with K&N pod filters
  • • Custom stainless 2-into-2 exhaust (layout in progress)
  • • Upgraded clutch springs, braided oil & brake lines planned

Chassis & Suspension

  • • Hand-built subframe with integrated LED tail + seat pan
  • • YSS monoshock conversion with bespoke mounting plates
  • • GSXR forks, Brembo front calipers & master cylinder
  • • Cognito Moto triple tree & stem conversion kit
  • • Custom spoked wheels, stainless spokes, refreshed hubs
  • • Brembo rear caliper & disc, custom rearsets with GSXR master (installed)

Electronics

  • • Motogadget m-unit blue, M-Lock keyless ignition
  • • Motogadget Motoscope Pro display + bar-end LED indicators
  • • Rae-San programmable ignition paired with OEM pickup
  • • Lithium battery relocated under the custom seat hump
  • • Full new wiring harness with braided sheathing
  • • High-output coils (non-OEM) & upgraded starter solenoid planned

Finishing

  • • Engine: satin black high-temp finish with polished covers
  • • Tank: satin black base with brushed aluminium panels (concept)
  • • Wheels: satin black rims, brushed hubs, gold anodized spoke nipples
  • • Suspension: YSS monoshock & GSXR forks refinished with gold accents
  • • Seat: Concept sketch in progress (upholstery TBD)
